com.xebialabs.restito.server

Class StubServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xebialabs.restito.server.StubServer

  • public class StubServer
extends java.lang.Object
    The HttpServer wrapper which is responsible for operations like starting and stopping and holding objects that describe server behavior.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_PORT 
      boolean secured
      Whether or not the server should run in HTTPS mode.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StubServer(Behavior behavior)
      Creates a server based on Behavior object
      StubServer(int port, Stub... stubs)
      This constructor allows to specify the port beside stubs.
      StubServer(Stub... stubs)
      Creates a server based on stubs that are used to determine behavior.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StubServer addStub(Stub s)
      It is possible to add a stub even after the server is started
      java.util.List<Call> getCalls()
      Returns calls performed to the serer
      int getPort()
      Returns the port which the server is running at
      java.util.List<Stub> getStubs()
      Returns stubs associated with the server
      StubServer run()
      Starts the server
      StubServer secured()
      Sets the Server in Secure mode.
      void start()
      Alias for StubServer.run()
      StubServer stop()
      Stops the server

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StubServer

        public StubServer(Stub... stubs)
        Creates a server based on stubs that are used to determine behavior.

      • StubServer

        public StubServer(int port,
          Stub... stubs)
        This constructor allows to specify the port beside stubs. If the port is busy, Restito won't try to pick different one and java.net.BindException will be thrown.

      • StubServer

        public StubServer(Behavior behavior)
        Creates a server based on Behavior object

    • Method Detail

      • addStub

        public StubServer addStub(Stub s)
        It is possible to add a stub even after the server is started

      • run

        public StubServer run()
        Starts the server

      • start

        public void start()
        Alias for StubServer.run()

      • stop

        public StubServer stop()
        Stops the server

      • secured

        public StubServer secured()
        Sets the Server in Secure mode. If it is already running, ignores the call.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port which the server is running at

      • getCalls

        public java.util.List<Call> getCalls()
        Returns calls performed to the serer

      • getStubs

        public java.util.List<Stub> getStubs()
        Returns stubs associated with the server
